meanings.def: what happens or appears if you do not make any other choice or change, especially in a computer program
examples: The default option is to save your work every five minutes.
All my life, envy has been my default emotion.

meanings.def: failure to do something that must be done by law, especially paying a debt
examples: in default (on something) The company is in default on the loan.
Mortgage defaults have risen in the last year.

meanings.def: a game or competition can be won by default if there are no other people, teams, etc. taking part
examples: He became world champion in 2007 by default.

meanings.def: if something happens by default, it happens because you have not made any other decision or choices that would make things happen in a different way
examples: I became a teacher by default rather than by design.

meanings.def: because of a lack of something
examples: They accepted what he had said in default of any evidence to disprove it.

idioms.def: a game or competition can be won by default if there are no other people, teams, etc. taking part
examples: He became world champion in 2007 by default.
I became a teacher by default rather than by design.

idioms.def: because of a lack of something
examples: They accepted what he had said in default of any evidence to disprove it.

meanings.def: to fail to do something that you legally have to do, especially by not paying a debt
to happen when you do not make any other choice or change
examples: The progam defaults to the standard style each time you open it.
